channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump and his plan to win a second term unmasked in Michigan visit
item.description: President Donald Trump's debasing of fact, divide-and-rule tactics and endless quest for new political enemies may be disastrous in a pandemic. But such behavior, combined with the promise of an American comeback, still adds up to a formidable electoral arsenal.

item.title: China to propose hugely controversial national security law in Hong Kong
Legendary virus hunter speaks out after getting infected
item.description: Legendary virus hunter Peter Piot developed coronavirus symptoms in March and is still experiencing the aftereffects. He speaks with Christiane Amanpour about his ordeal.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Updates from around the world
He closed his country before a single case of Covid-19. Is he a savior, or a strongman?
item.description: • School reopens then shuts again after two students test positive • Two-day-old baby dies of Covid-19

item.title: CDC estimates that 35% of coronavirus patients don't have symptoms
Watch the entire CNN coronavirus town hall
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta host a global town hall answering your questions about what the future holds for the fight against Covid-19. Watch the full event below.

item.title: Trump confirms US is withdrawing from another major arms treaty
item.description: The Trump administration is preparing to withdraw from the Open Skies Treaty that was designed to reduce the risk of military miscalculations that could lead to war, making it the latest major arms control treaty that the US will abandon under President Donald Trump.

item.title: CNN's Anderson Cooper reacts to 'utterly heartless' Trump tweet
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reacts to President Trump's barrage of tweets discrediting mail-in ballots, insulting his political rivals and making unsubstantiated claims about Joe Scarborough, the host of MSNBC's "Morning Joe".

item.title: The early results are in on Sweden's 'herd immunity' strategy
item.description: Sweden has revealed that despite adopting more relaxed measures to control coronavirus, only 7.3% of people in Stockholm had developed the antibodies needed to fight the disease by late April.

item.title: Drone footage captures mass graves dug in Brazil
item.description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh takes us inside of an ICU in Sao Paulo, Brazil, where medical personnel are struggling to meet the needs of those infected with coronavirus.

item.title: Everyone you know uses Zoom. That wasn't the plan.
item.description: The tweet was when Eric Yuan knew something had to change.

item.title: Drug smugglers used bottles of hand sanitizer to conceal meth shipments
item.description: Drug smugglers took advantage of the current pandemic to conceal methamphetamine in shipments of hand sanitizer and face masks sent to Australia, according to officials.

item.title: Here's how Covid-19 could change the way we fly
item.description: As the world slowly eases its way out of the Covid-19 lockdown, we're on the verge of a new era in air travel.

item.title: Nurse who lost 50 lbs. from virus: I pretty much cried when I looked in the mirror
item.description: CNN's John Berman speaks with Mike Schultz, the San Francisco nurse who shared before and after pictures of himself showing the impact that Covid-19 had on his body.

item.title: Lori Loughlin and Mossimo Giannulli agree to plead guilty in college admissions scam
item.description: Actress Lori Loughlin and fashion designer Mossimo Giannulli have agreed to plead guilty to conspiracy charges in connection with their role in the college admissions scam, the US Attorney's Office in the District of Massachusetts said.

item.title: Scientists make mouse embryo with highest level of human cells in an animal yet
item.description: Scientists have created a mouse embryo that's part human -- 4% to be exact.

item.title: US Senate confirms Trump intel chief who had previously withdrawn nomination
item.description: Rep. John Ratcliffe was confirmed Thursday as President Donald Trump's top intelligence official on a party-line Senate vote, putting the Texas Republican into the center of a political firestorm over the FBI's prosecution of Michael Flynn and its Russia investigation.

item.title: Doctor studying recovering patients makes an unexpected find
item.description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta discusses the potential long-term effects Covid-19 could have on the lungs based on past coronavirus outbreaks.

item.title: WWE star's wife breaks silence after he was found dead on California beach
item.description: The wife of former WWE superstar Shad Gaspard broke her silence on Thursday, one day after the wrestler's body was found on a Southern California beach.

item.title: Scientists say they may have found a skinny gene
Mom's homeschooling rant goes viral. See what happened when her kids returned to school.
item.description: As students in Israel return to school, CNN catches up with one mother whose frustration at homeschooling went viral.

item.title: A son stabbed and killed his father during a Zoom meeting, police say
item.description: A Long Island man was stabbed and killed by his son during a Zoom video chat with several people Thursday, Suffolk County Police announced.

item.title: Cyclone is a bigger disaster than coronavirus outbreak for India and Bangladesh
item.description: Thousands of people have been left homeless in the wake of Cyclone Amphan, which slammed into India's eastern coast on Wednesday afternoon, as authorities race to provide relief efforts in communities already stricken by the coronavirus.

item.title: Though far from the norm, nearly 500 US flights per day depart more than 70% full
item.description: Some passengers will arrive at the airport and find their flight is too full to allow for the neighboring seat to remain empty, according to data from a US airline industry group.

item.title: A two-day-old baby has died of Covid-19 in South Africa
item.description: A two-day-old baby has died of coronavirus-related condition in South Africa, the government said Thursday.

item.title: Snow is turning green in Antarctica -- and climate change will make it worse
item.description: Green snow created by blooming algae in the Antarctic Peninsula is likely to spread as temperatures increase as a result of climate change, researchers have said, after creating the first large-scale map of the organisms and their movements.

item.title: Here's what the office of the future may look like
item.description: As countries begin reopening, offices are redesigning their environments to keep workers safe from coronavirus. CNN's Clare Sebastian reports.

item.title: Nepal issues a new map claiming contested territories with India as its own
item.description: Nepal has issued a new national map incorporating areas also claimed by neighboring India, prompting fierce criticism from New Delhi.

item.title: A family finds nearly $1 million in cash in the middle of the road. Police want to know how the money ended up there
item.description: A Virginia family was just trying to get out of the coronavirus blues by taking a long drive when they found what turned out to be nearly $1 million in cash in the middle of the road.

item.title: Biologist explains how to safely celebrate holiday weekend
item.description: University of Massachusetts Dartmouth Biology Professor Erin Bromage shares tips on how to safely celebrate this Memorial Day weekend to reduce coronavirus spread.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen: NYT's decision to shelve columnist who criticized me 'sucks'
item.description: Chrissy Teigen has weighed in on New York Times writer Alison Roman's food column being put on leave.

item.title: CNN's Chris Cuomo teases brother Andrew with giant test swab
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo jokes with his brother, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, about the size of his nose. On May 17, the governor was tested for Covid-19 on live television to encourage others to get tested.

item.title: I tried to delete myself from the internet. Here's what I learned
item.description: It was MyLife that broke me. After spending hours studying FAQ pages, sending terse emails and making occasional phone calls in an earnest-if-naive attempt to take back some control of my personal information online, I had my first demoralizing moment.

item.title: Why you shouldn't worry about eating the bugs that live on your strawberries
item.description: Bugs crawling on your strawberries? That's normal, according to some experts, despite a recent TikTok trend that suggests otherwise.

item.title: This man reuniting with his donkey will melt your heart
item.description: Ismael Fernández thought his pet donkey Baldomera would not remember him after he had been under quarantine, but the beloved animal gave him an unexpectedly emotional reunion.

item.title: Trailblazing British Paralympian dies aged 91
item.description: Margaret Maughan, Great Britain's first Paralympic champion, has died at the age of 91.

item.title: Debby Ryan and Josh Dun secretly married on New Year's Eve
item.description: It's nearly impossible these days for a high-profile couple to keep something under wraps, let alone a wedding.

item.title: TikTok needs to win over Washington. Hiring a CEO from Disney won't be enough
item.description: TikTok's hiring of Disney veteran Kevin Mayer was widely seen as a move — at least in part — to win over the growing number of US lawmakers who claim the popular short video platform is a threat to America's national security.

item.title: Photos show rebellious youths of the '90s and '00s
item.description: In the late 1990s, photographer Justine Kurland imagined runaway girls roaming the American landscape -- gathering in the woods, along highways and in open fields. Instead of encountering danger, these wayward spirits would form a sylvan utopia where girls could make their own rules.

item.title: You can get a Michelin-starred meal here for $1.50
item.description: Chan Hon Meng is the master chef behind Hong Kong Soya Sauce Chicken Rice and Noodle, the food cart home to the cheapest Michelin-starred meal in the world. Ringing in at a mere $1.50, Meng's perfected braised chicken recipe was passed down to him by his uncle.

item.title: Mo Salah says Champions League final goal celebration was inspired by daughter
Pac-Man at 40: The eating icon that changed gaming history
item.description: When "Pac-Man" debuted in Tokyo 40 years ago, no one could have predicted it would become the most successful arcade game of all time.

item.title: Crashing 3D waves create unreal optical illusion
item.description: Beachside vacations may seem like a distant memory during coronavirus lockdowns, but in Seoul's Gangnam District, the ocean has come to the city.

item.title: Michigan AG rips Trump for going maskless on camera at Ford plant
item.description: • Live updates: CDC estimates 35% of cases asymptomatic

item.title: The US coronavirus crisis is far from over, researchers say
Melania Trump shares words of encouragement for students
item.description: First lady Melania Trump thanked students on Thursday for adapting to the new realities of life during the ongoing coronavirus pandemic in her first solo broadcast address to the nation.

item.title: We will be seeing more of the scientists from the White House coronavirus task force soon, Fauci says
item.description: The public will be seeing more of Dr. Anthony Fauci, the popular director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases.

item.title: China set to propose security law blasted as the 'end' of Hong Kong
item.description: • China will not set economic growth target • NPC 2020: China's defense budget rises 6.6% • Hong Kong stocks drop as tensions flare

item.title: Pompeo ordered officials to find a way to justify Saudi arms sale
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo pushed State Department officials to find a way to justify the emergency declaration that he had already decided to implement in order to fast-track the $8 billion arms sale to Saudi Arabia last year -- stunning career diplomats, four sources have told CNN.
